attributes.action: Give the people the power to call a general election.
attributes.additional_details: It is anathema in a modern democracy that a Prime Minister and government, which may quickly prove to be disastrous for the prosperity and wellbeing of the country cannot be brought to a General Election by the initiative of the people at law, instead having to be suffered by the people for a full five years. That is not democratic. The people must have the power, with enough numbers, to trigger a change of government sooner, should they see fit. General elections used to be annual.
attributes.background: HMG should enact a law by which 50% of the electorate in two thirds of constituencies can trigger a general election by petition or letter/email to their MP.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions, which call for similar action:

"Give the British Public the Right to Vote No Confidence in the Government"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734311

"Pass a law that triggers an early General Election via a public petition"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/739383
